result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel S. Lahner

records.addlTxt:
(Case called at 2:37 PM) Defendant Daniel S. Lahner in court, in custody with Attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State calls Detective Timothy Peterson, Altoona Police Department, sworn and testifies. Detective identifies Defendant. Cross-examination of Detective Peterson by Defense. Witness is excused. State makes argument for bind over. Defense makes argument. 
Court finds a reasonable person would be fearful, finds probable cause and binds the matter over. 
Arraignment to be scheduled with Branch 2 Judicial Assistant.

9:50 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Daniel S. Lahner not in court, not brought over from Eau Claire Jail. Attorney Scott S. Schlough in court for Daniel S. Lahner. Attorney Schlough requests a date for a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Non-party correspondence from Jeffrey Borgwardt to Court regarding defendant; no indication that copies were provided to other parties.

Non-party correspondence from Samantha Kewin to Court regarding defendant; copies provided to all parties.
Non-party correspondence from Doreen Lahner to Court regarding defendant; copies provided to all parties.

(9:58 AM case called.) Defendant Daniel S. Lahner in court, in custody. Attorney Scott S. Schlough in court for Daniel S. Lahner. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
Court advises has read Attorney Schlough's written admission and requests comments.
Attorney Schlough makes argument for bond reduction and advises realizes some cash is necessary given the charges.
State advises circumstances have not changed since the original cash bond was imposed. State opposes any modification to bond.
Attorney Schlough advises the defendant's circumstances have changed as the defendant is now medicated.
Court orders the motion to modify bond is denied.
Hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 9:30 am (in intake court).
Bail/bond hearing on September 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:32 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Daniel S. Lahner in court, in custody. Attorney Scott S. Schlough in court for Daniel S. Lahner. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. Preliminary hearing for today to be removed.

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 09/26/2022 at 2:00 PM
Hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 11:20 AM.
Defendant Daniel S. Lahner appeared by video, in custody from the jail with Attorney Sonia Anderson.  Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives reading of Complaint. State requests $10,000 Cash Bond (3 stalking cases with the same victims, violent and threatening tendencies). Court orders $10,000 Cash Bond.
Preliminary Hearing: 9/6/22 at 2:00 PM.

Conditions: 
No contact with L.G., B.J., their families, their residences.
Defendant not to have violent/abusive contact or acts/threats of violence toward anyone.
No access to Facebook at all.
